thread.title: Bill Belichick on lack of depth: 'We had a lot of Ironmen out there'
thread.title_full: Bill Belichick on lack of depth: 'We had a lot of Ironmen out there' | Boston Herald

author: Adam Kurkjian
title: Bill Belichick on lack of depth: 'We had a lot of Ironmen out there'
text:
Bill Belichick on lack of depth: 'We had a lot of Ironmen out there' Adam Kurkjian Patriots tight end Rob Gronkowski bulls his way for extra yards while being tackled by Jets defenders yesterday at Gillette Stadium. comments Tweet With the injuries that piled up for the Patriots heading into Sunday's game, just 18 offensive players were active for the 30-23 victory over the Jets.
In a conference call today, coach Bill Belichick noted that number is "v ery rare."
Considering one of the players on the active roster was special teams ace Matthew Slater, it makes the lack of depth even more significant.
"I don't think I've ever gone in with that few players," Belichick said. "I really, you count Slater as one of them, but you know how many plays he's played on offense in his career here."
Despite this disadvantage, the Patriots were still able to rally in the fourth quarter for the victory and take a 6-0 record and two-game lead in the AFC East into Thursday night's showdown with the Dolphins.
"Yeah, we were pretty thin all the way across," Belichick said. "The guys all stepped up and did a really good job. We had a lot of Ironmen out there."
